children.name: Kick-off request at the system-level export endpoint
Requires authorization header
children.description: The server should require authorization header at the system-level export endpoint

children.name: Rejects expired token
children.description: The server should reject expired tokens at the system-level export endpoint

children.name: Rejects invalid token
children.description: The server should reject invalid tokens at the system-level export endpoint

children.name: Kick-off request at the patient-level export endpoint
Requires authorization header
children.description: The server should require authorization header at the patient-level export endpoint

children.name: Rejects expired token
children.description: The server should reject expired tokens at the patient-level export endpoint

children.name: Rejects invalid token
children.description: The server should reject invalid tokens at the patient-level export endpoint

children.name: Kick-off request at the group-level export endpoint
Requires authorization header
children.description: The server should require authorization header at the group-level export endpoint

children.name: Rejects expired token
children.description: The server should reject expired tokens at the group-level export endpoint

children.name: Rejects invalid token
children.description: The server should reject invalid tokens at the group-level export endpoint

children.name: Requires "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" POSTs
children.description: After generating an authentication JWT, the client requests a new access token via HTTP POST to the FHIR authorization server's token endpoint URL, using content-type application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

children.name: The 'grant_type' parameter must be present
children.description: The server should reply with 400 Bad Request if the grant_type parameter is not sent by the client.

children.name: The "grant_type" must equal "client_credentials"
children.description: The server should reply with 400 Bad Request if the grant_type parameter is not client_credentials.

children.name: The "client_assertion_type" must be present
children.description: The server should reply with 400 Bad Request if the client_assertion_type parameter is not sent by the client.

children.name: The "client_assertion_type" must be jwt-bearer
children.description: The server should reply with 400 Bad Request if the client_assertion_type parameter is not equal to urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-bearer

children.name: The client_assertion parameter must be a token
children.description: This test verifies that if the client sends something other then a JWT, the server will detect it and reject the request.

children.name: Validates authenticationToken.aud
children.description: The aud claim of the authentication JWT must be the authorization server's "token URL" (the same URL to which this authentication JWT will be posted)

children.name: Validates authenticationToken.iss
children.description: The iss claim of the authentication JWT must equal the registered client_id

children.name: Only accept registered client IDs
children.description: Verify that clients can't use random client id

children.name: Requires scope
children.description: The server should reject requests to the token endpoint that do not specify a scope

children.name: Rejects empty scope
children.description: The server should reject requests to the token endpoint that are requesting an empty scope

children.name: Validates scopes
children.description: This test verifies that only valid system scopes are accepted by the server

children.name: Supports wildcard action scopes
children.description: Verifies that scopes like system/Patient.* are supported

children.name: Rejects unknown action scopes
children.description: Verifies that scopes like system/Patient.unknownAction are rejected

children.name: Supports wildcard resource scopes
children.description: Verifies that scopes like system/*.read are supported

children.name: Rejects unknown resource scopes
children.description: Verifies that scopes like system/UnknownResource.read are rejected

children.name: validates the jku token header
children.description: When present, the jky authentication JWT header should match a value that the client supplied to the FHIR server at client registration time. This test attempts to authorize using test-bad-jku as jky header value and expects that to produce an error.

children.name: Validates the token signature
children.description: This test attempts to obtain an access token with a request that is completely valid, except that the authentication token is signed with unknown private key.

children.name: Authorization using JWKS URL and ES384 keys
children.description: Verify that the server supports JWKS URL authorization using ES384 keys. This would also prove that JWK keys rotation works because this test will create new key, every time it is executed.

children.name: Authorization using JWKS URL and RS384 keys
children.description: Verify that the server supports JWKS URL authorization using RS384 keys. This would also prove that JWK keys rotation works because this test will create new key, every time it is executed.

children.name: Requires valid access token if the requiresAccessToken field in the status body is true
children.description: If the requiresAccessToken field in the Complete Status body is set to true, the request MUST include a valid access token.

children.name: Does not require access token if the requiresAccessToken field in the status body is not true
children.description: Verifies that files can be downloaded without authorization if the requiresAccessToken field in the complete status body is not set to true

children.name: Replies properly in case of error
children.description: The server should return HTTP Status Code of 4XX or 5XX

children.name: Generates valid file response
children.description:
Runs a set of assertions to verify that:
  • The server returns HTTP status of 200 OK
  • The server returns a Content-Type header that matches the file format being delivered. For files in ndjson format, MUST be application/fhir+ndjson
  • The response body is valid FHIR ndjson (unless other format is requested)
  • An Accept header might be sent (optional, defaults to application/fhir+ndjson)

children.name: Rejects a download if the client scopes do not cover that resource type
children.description: If the download endpoint requires authorization, it should also verify that the client has been granted access to the resource type that it attempts to download. This test makes an export and then it re-authorizes before downloading the first file, so that the download request is made with a token that does not provide access to the downloaded resource.

children.name: Requires Accept header
children.description: The Accept header specifies the format of the optional OperationOutcome response to the kick-off request. Currently, only application/fhir+json is supported.

children.name: Requires Prefer header to equal respond-async
children.description: The Prefer request header is required and specifies whether the response is immediate or asynchronous. The header MUST be set to respond-async. Red More

children.name: Accepts _outputFormat=application/fhir+ndjson
children.description: Verifies that the server accepts application/fhir+ndjson as _outputFormat parameter

children.name: Accepts _outputFormat=application/ndjson
children.description: Verifies that the server accepts application/ndjson as _outputFormat parameter

children.name: Accepts _outputFormat=ndjson
children.description: Verifies that the server accepts ndjson as _outputFormat parameter

children.name: Rejects unsupported format "_outputFormat=application/xml"
children.description: This tests if the server rejects _outputFormat=application/xml parameter, even though application/xml is valid mime type.

children.name: Rejects unsupported format "_outputFormat=text/html"
children.description: This tests if the server rejects _outputFormat=text/html parameter, even though text/html is valid mime type.

children.name: Rejects unsupported format "_outputFormat=x-custom"
children.description: This tests if the server rejects _outputFormat=x-custom parameter, even though x-custom is valid mime type.

children.name: Rejects _since={invalid date} parameter
children.description: The server should reject exports if the _since parameter is not a valid date

children.name: Rejects _since={future date} parameter
children.description: The server should reject exports if the _since parameter is a date in the future

children.name: Validates the _type parameter
children.description: Verifies that the request is rejected if the _type contains invalid resource type

children.name: Accepts the _typeFilter parameter
children.description: The _typeFilter parameter is optional so the servers should not reject it, even if they don't support it

children.name: Response - Success
children.description: Verifies that the server starts an export if called with valid parameters. The status code must be 202 Accepted and a Content-Location header must be returned. The response body should be either empty, or a JSON OperationOutcome.

children.name: Requires Accept header
children.description: The Accept header specifies the format of the optional OperationOutcome response to the kick-off request. Currently, only application/fhir+json is supported.

children.name: Requires Prefer header to equal respond-async
children.description: The Prefer request header is required and specifies whether the response is immediate or asynchronous. The header MUST be set to respond-async. Red More

children.name: The CapabilityStatement instantiates the bulk-data CapabilityStatement
Includes the token endpoint in the CapabilityStatement
Check if "export" operation is defined in the CapabilityStatement
Check if "patient-export" operation is defined in the CapabilityStatement
Check if "group-export" operation is defined in the CapabilityStatement
Includes token_endpoint definition
children.description: This test verifies that the server provides a /.well-known/smart-configuration and that a token_endpoint property is declared within that file.

children.name: Responds with 202 for active transaction IDs
children.description:
The status endpoint should return 202 status code until the export is completed.

See https://github.com/HL7/bulk-data/blob/master/spec/export/index.md#response---in-progress-status

children.name: Replies properly in case of error
children.description:
Runs a set of assertions to verify that:
  • The returned HTTP status code is 5XX
  • The server returns a FHIR OperationOutcome resource in JSON format

Note that even if some of the requested resources cannot successfully be exported, the overall export operation MAY still succeed. In this case, the Response.error array of the completion response MUST be populated (see below) with one or more files in ndjson format containing FHIR OperationOutcome resources to indicate what went wrong.

See https://github.com/HL7/bulk-data/blob/master/spec/export/index.md#response---error-status-1

children.name: Generates valid status response
children.description:
Runs a set of assertions to verify that:
  • The status endpoint should return 200 status code when the export is completed
  • The status endpoint should respond with JSON
  • The expires header (if set) must be valid date in the future
  • The JSON response contains transactionTime which is a valid FHIR instant
  • The JSON response contains the kick-off URL in request property
  • The JSON response contains requiresAccessToken boolean property
  • The JSON response contains an output array in which:
    • Every item has valid type property
    • Every item has valid url property
    • Every item may a count number property
  • The JSON response contains an error array in which:
    • Every item has valid type property
    • Every item has valid url property
    • Every item may a count number property
